bug.description:

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/karriebear>@karriebear</denchmark-link> Do you have any ideas on what may have changed between these versions?

Between <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/compare/0.61.0...0.66.0>0.61 and 0.66</denchmark-link> we fixed a bug for when a session is disconnected and added the deprecation warning. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Laksh1997>@Laksh1997</denchmark-link> is your deployed instance publicly available? If not, do you mind taking a quick screen recording or sharing some screenshots? Additionally, can you share your code or a small reproducible sample? We've been working with apps on a Kubernetes environment and have been able to upload files successfully. Pardon the mess but see <denchmark-link:https://s4a.streamlit.io/karriebear/home-locator/master/main.py/+/>here</denchmark-link> for example
I've encountered an issue with this as well previously, using Kubernetes with multiple replicas. I was able to have it fixed by using sticky sessions.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Laksh1997>@Laksh1997</denchmark-link> echoing Karrie's question - is your deployed instance publicly accessible? If not, could you please share the Kubernetes manifest files with us?
Hey, I'm closing this issue since it's been inactive for over 30 days. Feel free to reopen if you're still experiencing it and have some more info to add.
